alert.note: Alert for Kit Carson (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Goodland (Northwestern Kansas and East Central Colorado)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued June 17 at 9:10AM MDT until June 17 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Goodland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 3 PM MDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of east central Colorado, including the following county, Kit Carson. * WHEN...Until 300 PM MDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 908 AM MDT, local law enforcement reported flooding in the warned area. Multiple roads around the Flagler area have been closed due to flooding. Between 1 and 3 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Flagler and Seibert. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
